utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If it's a tumor, we start chemo. Bombard his head with radiation.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which will probably kill him in this state.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And without an MRI, we don't even know if he has one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's definitely dead if we do nothing. If I'm wrong, all we do is shave a few hours off.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We'll need his wife's consent.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Masters will get it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Probably not a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Uh, he's right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, he's not. Consider this me officially booting you out of the nest.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just wanted to watch.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Do you even like me?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I put making friends and having relationships on hold so I could concentrate on studying. I always thought there'll be plenty of time for that in the future. But… now when I do want them… I can't even get a date to this charity event. If I can't establish relationships in my personal life, how will I ever do it with a patient?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Be honest with her. But if it comes down to a choice between the brutal truth and hope, side with hope.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He's in a coma. We think it's a brain tumor, and we need your permission to start treatment. Due to his current condition, the risk factor…

utterance.speaker: Diane
utterance.content: You mean… it could kill him?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's possible. But… there is still hope.

utterance.speaker: Diane
utterance.content: Can he hear me? They say that… that people in coma can still do that.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Sometimes, but your husband's hearing… is fine.

utterance.speaker: Diane
utterance.content: I didn't mean any of those awful things I said. I'm so sorry. I love you, Bert. I've always loved you. I also kept a secret from you. I was gonna tell you at the restaurant… but you got sick. And I wanted to wait until you felt better. I'm pregnant, sweetheart. You're gonna be a daddy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why rash again? It went away. It needs a reason to come back. We know it's not an allergic reaction, so we must have done something to set it off again. What?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We put him on dialysis?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Moved him to the ICU?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We also did a partial MRI.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Two hours before the rash came back. They're not connected.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What was he doing two hours before he broke out the first time?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Cleaning a crime scene.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Crime scene and an MRI. Still not seeing the connection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We've been missing connections this entire case. Did he say anything? Did he show any signs of stress in the MRI room?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He said he was cold, but it's always freezing in there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cold and rash.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Cold urticaria causes rash, but it's almost instantaneous and not time-delayed.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And it wouldn't explain his other symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Muckle-Wells syndrome? There's only been a couple thousand documented cases in the U.S.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, now there's a couple thousand and one. Fits every symptom there. We're idiots for not seeing it before. Treat with rilonacept. He'll live a long and healthy life filled with lies to his wife and future child.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why wouldn't I be? Solved my case.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: But your patient died.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I just came to apologize. You're right. I am turning bitter and cynical inside.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're finally putting the cat down. She loves mariachi. I told you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Go home and… change. Party's in a few hours.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You don't have to move out if you don't want to. I realize you might have had a point. I've been alone a long time. And I don't want to end up like House.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What you said about me and my marriage was…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I was being an ass.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: True. But you were right. I needed to hear it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So we're good.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You know, I have a couple tickets…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Don't push it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Taub and Foreman done? I'm hitching a ride with them.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You're not picking up your date?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Naw. Going solo. All those meaningless relationships tend to wear a guy out after a while.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We've got 15 minutes to get there if we wanna see the board freak when House's mariachi band marches in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All of them are gone, Wilson. They're all dead because I am screwed up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You lost one patient. And it wasn't your fault.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What about that mom who gave her baby cancer? If I'd figured that one out quicker, she'd still be a mom alive.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She refused treatment when it was offered. How is that your fault?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And there was that guy I spent a day trapped in isolation with. He was five feet away the whole time. Just watched him die like an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. You've lost patients before, and you'll lose patients again. Why…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly! Why? Because love and happiness are… nothing but distractions. The only thing my relationship with Cuddy has done for me is make me a worse doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My happiness is being paid for by other people's lives. How is she?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She's worried. She's upset that you didn't show up tonight.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: First… first, you're not driving anywhere. And second, you are definitely not talking to Cuddy like this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. I'm gonna walk.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We really, really need to talk.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're drunk. And you screwed up big time. Go home! You completely disappeared on me. You wouldn't even answer your cell phone.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Shut up. You're too drunk to end this relationship.
